Title: Senior Data Analyst - Subscriber Lifecycle Analytics
Description:
About The Role & Team

The Subscriber Lifecycle Analytics team is looking for a Senior Data Analyst who will help to measure, understand, and take action to mitigate subscriber churn across a growing ecosystem of Disney’s streaming service offerings (Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+). Our team masters exploratory data analysis, advanced reporting, data visualization and storytelling to deliver actionable insights and provide recommendations to drive business decision-making. This team collaborates cross-functionally across the Direct to Consumer organization as well as with stakeholders from business units across The Walt Disney Company to generate insightful, compelling, and strategic analyses. This role will build strong relationships and partner closely with Finance, Business Operations, Business Strategy, and other Analytics teams to ensure the business understands complex retention trends and implications for strategic decision making. The team’s work will drive the development of business and operational plans that are expected to have broad influence at all levels of the organization.

What You'll Do


Communicate complex trends and churn drivers to a wide array of business stakeholders with varying technical expertise from operational teams to executive audiences, both in oral presentations and via written reportsPartner closely with business stakeholders (Product, Business Operations, Finance, Marketing etc.) to identify and unlock opportunities for improved subscriber retentionCreate and maintain operational dashboards in Tableau and Looker to understand performance over time, enable efficient exploratory analysis, and equip partners with self-serve toolsTranslate complex business questions into SQL including proper cohorting, calculations, filtering criteria and/or aggregationsPartner with Data Science teams to uplevel analyses using clustering/segmentation, regression modeling, and/or predictive modeling


Key Qualifications


5+ years of strategic analysis to inform product or business decision making3+ years of hands-on analytical work experience with SQL (ETL ownership, complex transformations, development of “analytical” datasets) Strong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis and recommendationsAbility to think strategically, analyze and interpret first and third party informationExperience manipulating large data sets and interpreting data trends using a multitude of disparate data sources and toolsExpertise with data exploration and data visualization tools like Tableau or LookerStrong analytical and technical skills to troubleshoot issues, analyze the cause, quickly come-up with possible solutions, document the changes, and communicate organizational impactStrong experience in documenting the data requirements, data strategy, data rules (standardization, cleansing, and validation)


Nice To Haves


Experience in the streaming media industry and/or supporting a direct-to-consumer or subscription-based productExperience in the technology industry and knowledge of how to build and implement data productsExperience presenting data stories to executive audiencesExperience operating in an SDLC environment and deploying code


Required Education


Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Marketing, a related field, and/or relevant work experience


The hiring range for this position in Santa Monica, CA is $112,600 to $151,000, and in New York, NY is $118,000 to $158,200 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

GoodRx is America’s healthcare marketplace. Each month, millions of people visit goodrx.com to find reliable health information and discounts for their healthcare — and we’ve helped people save $60 billion since 2011. We provide prescription discounts that are accepted at more than 70,000 pharmacies in the U.S., as well as telehealth services including doctor visits and lab tests. Our goal is to help Americans find convenient and affordable healthcare. We offer solutions for consumers, employers, health plans, and anyone else who shares our desire to provide affordable prescriptions to all Americans.

CRM and Retention Marketing plays a vital role in the overall GoodRx growth strategy. GoodRx is expanding its retention marketing efforts to increase engagement and utilization of services valued by our customers and is looking for a talented analyst to help drive that growth.

The Sr. BI Analyst will assist the Sr. Director of Business Intelligence in the strategy, optimization, and reporting of CRM initiatives and retention campaigns. In this role, you will partner closely with our CRM team - who are in charge of creating campaigns to increase member growth, engagement, utilization, and upsell/cross-sell through email, SMS, push notification, and in-app offers - to perform analysis, offer strategic insights and recommendation, and provide timely results reporting. You will also collaborate with our CRM Ops, Data Engineering, and Data Science teams to enrich our data infrastructure and develop innovative new methods of measuring performance. We are looking for someone with a unique combination of technical skills and strategic thinking who can transform complex analyses into actionable insights.

An ideal candidate will be a self-motivated, independent problem solver who is excited to dive into the details, ask questions, make recommendations, and drive results.

Responsibilities

Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to define key performance indicators, set targets, measure and monitor performance, and provide insights and analysesLead analytic efforts to understand and report on customer behavior and business optimization opportunity (identify new customers, repeat business, reduce churn, improved channel and customer targeting methods)Develop automated dashboards and reports to monitor business trends and maintain a pulse on overall KPI healthPerform full funnel analyses to identify optimization opportunities, synthesize findings into an actionable story, and make recommendationsEngage with Data Engineering to build out next-level data infrastructure/marketing toolsBrainstorm, size, and test growth opportunities in retention marketingSupport planning and measurement of tests (A/B, incrementality, pre/post)Brainstorm innovative measurement and attribution strategies for new and existing marketing initiatives

Skills & Qualifications

You will also collaborate with our CRM Ops, Data Engineering, and Data Science teams to enrich our data infrastructure and develop innovative new methods of measuring performance. We are looking for someone with a unique combination of technical skills and strategic thinking who can transform complex analyses into actionable insights. An ideal candidate will be a self-motivated, independent problem solver who is excited to dive into the details, ask questions, make recommendations, and drive results. Responsibilities

  • Perform full funnel analyses to identify optimization opportunities, synthesize findings into an actionable story, and make recommendations
  • Engage with Data Engineering to build out next-level data infrastructure/marketing tools

  • Support planning and measurement of tests (A/B, incrementality, pre/post)
  • Brainstorm innovative measurement and attribution strategies for new and existing marketing initiatives
Skills & Qualifications
  • 5+ years in business intelligence or analytical role supporting multiple stakeholders; Masters degree in a quantitative field is preferred
  • Strong SQL proficiency with joins, case statements, subqueries/temp tables, cast/convert, etc.
  • Strong Excel proficiency (statistical functions, regressions, linest, etc.)
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills
  • Proven ability to interpret data to find insights and drive recommendations
  • Strong quantitative and qualitative skills
  • Experience working with large datasets
  • Data visualization skills (Looker, Tableau etc.)
  • Experience with retention marketing campaign optimization (email, push, app)
  • Experience building pipelines using DBT or Airflow is a plus
